Game.GraphicalEngine

Class GLFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.GraphicalEngine.GLFont

  • public class GLFont
extends java.lang.Object

    creates GL renderable (blittable) font out of given AWT font. a jPCT texture is created and added to TextureManager on the fly.

    in contrast with its name, this class can be used for software renderer too. but to tell the truth, i would stick to Java2D for software renderer ;)

    this class uses TexturePack behind the scenes.
    Author:
    hakan eryargi (r a f t)
    See Also:
    TexturePack

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLFont(java.awt.Font font)

      • getGLFont

        public static GLFont getGLFont(java.awt.Font font,
               java.lang.String alphabet)
        returns cached font or creates a new one caches and returns it. note: cache mechanism doesnt take alphabet into account.

      • blitString

        public void blitString(com.threed.jpct.FrameBuffer buffer,
              java.lang.String s,
              int x,
              int y,
              int transparency,
              java.awt.Color color)
        blits given string to frame buffer. works very similar to awt.Graphics#drawString(..) that is: x coordinate is left most point in string, y is baseline
        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer to blit into
        s - string to blit
        x - leftmost point
        transparency - transparency value, make sure >= 0
        color - text color
        y - baseline
